pullRequest.title: [ML] Implement AucRoc metric for classification - HLRC
pullRequest.bodyText:
This PR implements HLRC and docs changes as a followup of #60502
Note: This PR must wait for #60502 to be merged first.
Relates #62160

nodes.bodyText: The usual pattern is to let the server decide what the default is when an option is not set. includeCurve should be a Boolean and not written if null.
What does the request mean when className == null? Does that return the results for all classes?

This was moved to classification.AucRocMetric?
I think the class is big enough to deserve its own file. Not necessary for this review though

beforeCommit.message: [ML] Implement AucRoc metric for classification - HLRC

nodes.bodyText: Done for both classification.AucRocMetric and outlierdetection.AucRocMetric.

This was moved to classification.AucRocMetric?

Yes, it was.
The idea is that classification package is the go-to location for all the classification evaluation code.
outlierdetection evaluation package should have as little code as possible (ideally only a thin facilitation layer above classification evaluation).

I think the class is big enough to deserve its own file. Not necessary for this review though

+1. Let's do it in another PR.

Actually this field is required for the metric to make sense.
Changed class_name to non-optional and changed the order of parameters so that the now-required class_name comes first (before optional include_curve).

afterCommit.message: Add top_classes_field to the Classification evaluation.
